alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Iberville; Pointe Coupee; West Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 30 at 4:19PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of West Baton Rouge, southeastern Pointe Coupee, south central East Feliciana, Iberville and western East Baton Rouge Parishes through 515 PM CDT... At 419 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lottie to near Broussard. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Baton Rouge, Zachary, Baker, Plaquemine, Port Allen, Addis, Brusly, Livonia, Maringouin, Slaughter, Rosedale, Grosse Tete, Erwinville, Ramah, Bayou Sorrel, Brownfields and Baton Rouge Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 128 and 155. Interstate 110 in Louisiana near mile marker 1, and between mile markers 4 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for southeastern Louisiana.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Iberville; Pointe Coupee; West Baton Rouge
